moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4: I always start with the queen's gambit in blitz games.
moves.2... dxc4: He accepts it, usually it's declined
moves.3. e3 Bf5 4. Bxc4: I win back my pawn and have a strong center
moves.6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a4: I was a little worried about a b pawn push.
moves.7... Bb4: Unfortunately, now I can't poke his bishop away.
moves.8. Qb3 Qc8 9. Bd2: Breaking the pin and completing minor piece development.
moves.9... a5 10. O-O-O: I decided to castle queenside because all my pieces are pointed kingside.
moves.11... O-O 12. g4 Bxc3 13. bxc3: I prefer to capture with pawns when it brings it closer to the center. Unfortunately, however my DSB is the worst of bad bishops.
moves.14... Nd5: He starts to shift his pieces over to queenside.
moves.15. h4 b6 16. Rh3: I decide to get my knight out of the pin
moves.16... Rb8: I think he's preparing for a attack queenside, however it never occurs.
moves.18. g5 g6 19. h5: My pawn storm starts to gather momentum
moves.19... Kg7 20. Ne5: Adding another attacker to the g pawn.
moves.20... f6: Hmm, any thoughts on this move?
moves.21. gxf6+ Nxf6 22. hxg6 Nxg6 23. Nxg6 Bx: And his bishop is pinned I wonder if I can make use of that.
moves.24. Bd3 Kf7: The king hops out of the pin
moves.25. Bxg6+ hxg6: And I finally get my open file to his king
moves.26. Qc2 Rg8 27. Rh6: That g pawn is what kept me from winning this game.
moves.27... g5 28. e4 g4 29. e5 Nd5 30. Qh7+ K: The attack is going full on now
moves.31. f3: I try in vain to get rid of that pawn
moves.31... g3 32. Be1 g2: And now my rook is completely immobilized :(
moves.33. Bh4: I bring my DSB into the attack
moves.33... Qe8 34. c4: That knight was driving my crazy, if he moves it then Rf6# is mate
moves.34... Qf7: RRRRRRGH if the knight wasn't there I could pin his queen to his king.
moves.35... Qxh7 36. Rxh7 exd5: Now I'm up by two points, but it's by no means over. That passer of blacks isn't going away any time soon
moves.37. Be7+ Ke8 38. Kd2: I harbor vague ideas about getting rid of the g pawn
moves.39... Rb7: I looked for some time, but I couldn't find a way of getting out of it.
moves.40. Kf2 Rxe7 41. Rxe7+ Kxe7 42. Rxg2: At least I get rid of that pawn.
moves.42... Rxg2+ 43. Kxg2: It becomes a king and pawn game
moves.43... Ke6 44. f4 Kf5: If he kills my f pawn, my e pawn marches on to glory
moves.45. Kf3 b5 46. axb5 cxb5: Uh-oh, he has two connected passers
moves.47. Ke2 b4 48. Kd2: I move my king over, but I don't think he can stop them.
moves.48... a4 49. Kc2 Ke6: Too bad he didn't take my f pawn.
moves.50. Kb2 Kf5: At this point I think the game is a draw. Neither side can force a pawn to promotion
And I declare a draw by three fold repetition. Please drop a comment and rate on the star system.
